intro: Mayepea caribaea, commonly known as the Caribbean hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and northern South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that come in shades of red, pink, and white. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, cottony seeds.
